group_1.textLeft: I'm gonna go talk to Dad again.

group_1.textCenter: Ah, so we're going with this template.@I see.

group_1.textLeft: [chara:800700:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]――!?@[wait:1.0][chara:800700:cheek_0][chara:800700:face_mtn_ex_020.exp.json][chara:800700:lipSynch_1]...Oh. Seira.
…………@[wait:1.0][chara:800700:lipSynch_1]...That scene just now...
The camera angle was good, but don't you think@it took a little too long to zoom in?

group_1.textRight: Huh? ...Ah, yeah. You might be right...

group_1.textLeft: And as for the panning... You're using it to@good effect, but it's still a bit too shaky.

group_1.textRight: Oh, yeah... I mean.@You watched it for me after all.

group_1.textLeft: …………[wait:1.0][chara:800700:lipSynch_1]Have you heard of a director@named Yamada Joey...?
He's pretty minor, though.@And no longer with us.

group_1.textRight: I've loved his films since a long time ago...
And even now that I've seen a lot of other@great films, I still think he's the best.
He's my number-one most respected film director@in the universe.

group_1.textLeft: I see...
...It's just like his.@The way your film feels.
The approach it takes to the story, the way it@takes an idea and runs headlong with it...
The quality of the low-angle shots, the way it@plays with the audience's emotions.
Every last detail reminds me of Director Joey.
You might...@Have pretty similar sensibilities...
...Have you heard the whole story yet?@He's long dead, you know?
He was beaten.@By his own dream.
What a terrible frame to end on.
His movies had a reputation for great endings,@but when it came to his own life? Total flop...

group_1.textRight: Do you remember those figures that you never@could get rid of?

group_1.textLeft: ...You're finally tall enough to reach the@top shelf, huh?
Guess you're not a little kid any more.
Seira.
You've heard about my brother's big,@tragic demise, yes?
And do you *still* want to be a film director@some day?
